content.description: Follow the bolt line that heads up the middle of the wall pulling through a crux midway through the climb.  It climbs just above the pod that is located in the middle of this small wall.
content.protection: Bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: As you enter the Kitchen Sink (Powerline Buttress) area you will come to a series of steps with logs holding the soil in place.  This is the middle climb on this wall containing 3 climbs.

content.description:
A tense and terrifying route with little to work with...

Begin up a small ramp and scramble to the base of the line. Start up a technical face with a high first bolt, then work small edges and mono's to a puzzling roof. Crank this section and fire the thin, bare face.

Sparse and sometimes slick, this one is a doozy! A brave lead,  this line finishes left at an anchor on a nice ledge.
content.location: This is the left of two bolted lines, directly under the roof.

content.description: First route on your right when entering the kitchen sink area. Boulder up a short face next to a tree then follow the right side of the formation up the face past 3 more bolts and a fixed pin to the anchors. Easy to get sucked around the arette but better if climbed on the face.
Climb the somewhat dirty step up to the first bolt and then continue up just to the right of the dihedral.  Sort of awkward and bouldery for a 5.9.
content.location: As you enter the Kitchen Sink (Powerline Buttress) area you will come to a series of steps with logs holding the soil in place.  This is the furthest left on this wall containing 3 climbs.

content.description:
Climb the easy face holds up to the roof, make the awkward pull and climb to the chains. Independent of it's neighbor

Night Shift

, this line follows the direct right side. You can skip the real crux (.11c) by crossing left onto

Night Shift

at the roof. This version is about 10b.
content.location: This route is furthest right on the wall with the roof.
